subject: Re: [junit] How to automatically generate test results?
msgSnippet: ... _JUnit Recipes_ has an example of this in the Testing Web Components chapter, related to testing JSPs, if I remember correctly. -- J. B. (Joe)
messageBody:
davidthi808 wrote:

> I would like to set up a unit test where I run it the first time and
> save to disk the values of the objects generated (we are talking
> thousands of values).
>
> I would then check the generated results by hand to insure that they
> are correct.
>
> Then I want to be able to run it in test mode where it does an
> assert on each value to make sure they match. And if they don't
> identify which object/property does not match.
>
> The beauty of this approach is if I make a change which changes the
> object values - I can re-generate the tests and only need to hand
> check the change location.
>
> Any suggestions?

_JUnit Recipes_ has an example of this in the "Testing Web Components"
chapter, related to testing JSPs, if I remember correctly.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
